action.action-desc: Mr. Bilirakis (for himself and Mr. Pappas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to ensure veterans may obtain a physical copy of a certain form by mail or at medical facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Requirement for Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make available to veterans physical copies of covered form for reimbursement of certain travel expenses

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall prescribe regulations to ensure that—

paragraph.text: a veteran may, for the purposes of submitting a claim for the reimbursement of expenses for travel under section 111 of title 38, United States Code—

subparagraph.text: obtain a physical copy of the covered form—

clause.text: by mail, upon the request of such veteran; or
at any medical facility of the Department; and

subparagraph.text: submit the covered form at any such medical facility; and

paragraph.text: any such medical facility to which a veteran submits the covered form—

subparagraph.text: processes such claim associated with such covered form, if applicable.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered form means Department of Veterans Affairs Form 10–3452 (or any successor document).
